title: Create a Basic Navigation Menu with React Router
description:
Implement a basic navigation system using React Router that allows users to switch between different pages in a single-page application.

**Requirements:**
1. Create a component named `App` that sets up the routing structure
2. Install and use React Router v6 (BrowserRouter, Routes, Route, Link)
3. Create three page components:
   - `HomePage`: Displays "Welcome to Our Website!"
   - `AboutPage`: Displays "About Us - Learn more about our company."
   - `ContactPage`: Displays "Contact Us - Get in touch with our team."
4. Create a navigation menu with links to all three pages
5. Each page should be accessible at its own URL:
   - `/` for Home
   - `/about` for About
   - `/contact` for Contact

**Implementation Details:**
- The App component should be the main entry point
- Use BrowserRouter to wrap the entire application
- Create a navigation bar that stays visible on all pages
- Each Link should have appropriate styling when active
- Ensure proper nesting of Routes inside Routes component
- Each page component should be a simple functional component

**Expected Behavior:**
- Navigation menu appears at the top of every page
- Clicking links changes the URL and displays the corresponding page
- Browser back/forward buttons work correctly
- Each page shows unique content based on the route

**Note:** This is a single-page application - page changes should not cause full page reloads.
description_preview: Set up basic page navigation using React Router with Home, About, and Contact pages
hints: Start by installing react-router-dom: `npm install react-router-dom`
Wrap your entire app with BrowserRouter component
Use the Routes component to define your route structure
Each Route should have a path prop and an element prop pointing to your component
Use Link components for navigation instead of anchor tags to prevent page reloads
